column4: hey guys i have 2 ubuntu's but im try to share folders but i cant acess the to shared folders
hey guys i have 2 ubuntu's but im try to share folders but i cant acess the to shared folders
thinking of using samba maybe?
ok... did you add users which can access the shares or are these open shares?
usually what I do is create the shared directory, set it to the samba user's group, and add any users that I need
I think you'll need to make sure that the user you plan to login with over samba also has a system account
it  have
and this user should have FS permissions which I'm assuming it does... does the share just not show up at all or do you get a "permission denied" error
if you can't connect it sounds like either the service is being blocked or is not running
how you do to connect do folder
an smb:// URL... seemed like you were doing it right. I usually do Places -> Connecto to server...
do these machines have some device sitting in between them?
also you may want to make sure you can connect to the samba server locally.. and it shouldn't matter where the folder is so long as the permissions are right
on the same side of the router?
did you check if you can connect locally
you mean samba works locally right? :P
is your smb.conf set to accept connections from only certain subnets?
can point me a site for i config de smb.conf ok ?
hold on...
have you seen this? it's pretty much what I was going to tell you: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SettingUpSamba#Samba%20Server%20Manual%20Configuration
